Journal.Title: The British journal of general practice : the journal of the Royal College of General Practitioners

Article.ArticleTitle: Integrated care pathways: a new approach for integrated care systems.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Department of Health Sciences, Hull York Medical School, University of York, York; Institute of Health Informatics, University College London, London.
Ridgmount Practice and the Lawson Practice, London; Quality Improvement Clinical Lead, Central Camden Primary Care Network, PPI STIMULATE-ICP, London.
Consultant Respiratory Physician and Deputy Clinical Divisional Director for Medical Specialities, University College London Hospital, London.

Department of Primary Care and Mental Health, University of Liverpool, Liverpool; Academic Associate GP, Brownlow Health, Liverpool; National Institute of Health and Care Research Applied Research Collaboration North West Coast, Liverpool.
Royal College of General Practitioners, London.

MedlineCitation.CoiStatement: Christina van der Feltz-Cornelis received travel and accommodation in the UK for a lecture from the Lloyd Register Foundation and travel and accommodation in the UK and an honorarium payment related to a lecture at the Big Questions in Neuroscience Annual Meeting from Janssen UK. She received NIHR funding for four projects, of which STIMULATE-ICP is one; from the British Medical Association, the EU Horizon Programme, and from the Netherlands Organisation for Health Research and Development. All co-authors received NIHR funding for the STIMULATE-ICP study. As ARC director Mark Gabbay is part-funded by NIHR Applied Research Collaboration North West Coast. Emily Attree is a Patient and Public Involvement member of the STIMULATE-ICP-Delphi study and clinical lead in a Quality Improvement Support Team for Central Camden Primary Care Network. Mel Heightman is National Specialty Advisor for Long Covid, NHS England.
